Overview

Bio

Interests

By training I'm a physicist and proud physics nerd (UC Berkeley 2019â€”Go Bears!). By nature I'm a passionate lifelong learner, an educator, a fierce advocate for climate action.

But for the climate crisis, I would be satisfied on a purely intellectual level as a theoretical particle physicist. However, the existential dread weighs heavily on me and I can't imagine not being a part of the solution. I therefore postponed any plans for a Ph. D. and pursued a career where I would use my technical skills to advance technological fixes to climate change. I got my start doing analytics at New Sun Road, a startup involved with solar microgrids in remote villages all over the world.

My time at New Sun Road was cut short by an early pandemic hiring freeze. A furious job hunt led me to ARISE High School in Oakland, where I spent two years as the physics, engineering, and computer science teacher. I learned a lot, enjoyed aspects of the job immensely, and cherished the relationships I built with students and fellow staff, but pandemic-era teaching was the hardest period in my life, and meanwhile my anxiety over the climate crisis continued to grow. I left ARISE in June 2022 and have been seeking a role in climate tech ever since.

During my last Spring at ARISE, I found a wonderful community of similarly concerned and climate-conscious citizens of Earth through the Climatebase Fellowship,

); } handleSummaryClick(e) { if (e.target.tagName === 'P') { const text = e.target.textContent; console.log('you clicked on one of these summary links!', text); } } } export default Home
